strapiPost.title: Weekend Roundup
strapiPost.content:
If we can just make it through this rainy Friday, it looks like we've got a beautiful, sunny weekend ahead of us. Here are some ideas to make the most of your weekend:

  • Concert hopping: Check out the local shows taking the stage around NWA this weekend, thanks to KUAF's live music rundown.
  • Into the woods: Yarn/Wire begins tonight, bringing a family-oriented interactive performance combining music, narration, and sound to create an enchanted forest environment to the Momentary from Mar 3-5.
  • Orchid you not: The Botanical Garden of the Ozarks' 12th annual Orchid Show & Sale begins Friday, Mar 3, for members only and will open to the public Mar 4-5.
  • Let's ride: Break out the mountain bikes with Women of OZ for their March Flagship Ride on Saturday, Mar 4, at 2p.
  • Night lights: Take an immersive stroll through a forest of lights that responds to your heart rate, body, voice, and movements during the Listening Forest's first weekend of 2023 at Crystal Bridges.
  • Going on record: Shop, eat food, and enjoy fun activities at the Market @ Record in Bentonville on Saturday, Jan 7, from 9a-12p.
  • Pro Bono: The U of A School of Law and Office of Entrepreneurship and Innovation are hosting a pro bono legal event on Saturday, Mar 4, to help entrepreneurs navigate the legal environment.

Have a great weekend, Northwest Arkansas!
